text: Hello everyone! I am facing some issues while uploading images in .webp format from local to HubSpot portal. Is there any solution for this.

Hello everyone! I’m reaching out because I have a particular situation with the Marketplace I need to resolve and I need to talk to someone on the HS team. We have an “old school” free marketplace instance of HubSpot that has legacy products on it. We’d like to move that over to another portal associated with our Partner account. We don’t want to lose stats and continue to build on our library seamlessly. What’s the best way of achieving this? Thanks in advance!

You should be able to upload to the file manager, though honestly I would suggest uploading a JPG or PNG.
We actually automatically progressively enhance your images to webp for browsers that support it. That way if someone views your site in a browser that doesn’t support it they get the png or jpg as a fallback.

For additional image optimization tips check out:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed#images>

Here’s some information on the automatic stuff we do for images in the CMS:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/cdn#image-compression-optimization-and-automatic-image-resizing>
